generalInfo: This riding safari takes you deep into the wild heart of Northern Kenya, exploring the vast landscapes and abundant wildlife of the Laikipia Plateau on horseback. Over several days, you’ll ride across private conservancies, stay in remote bush camps, and experience the thrill of tracking game from the saddle. With varied terrain, exclusive access, and a string of well-schooled horses, this is one of Africa’s most exhilarating equestrian adventures. The goal is to give you a deeper, more intimate connection with Kenya’s wilderness - an unforgettable journey through one of the continent’s last true frontiers.

dayInfo.description: Fly from Nairobi Wilson to Nanyuki, where you’ll be met on arrival and transferred to Sosian Lodge, arriving in time for lunch. Enjoy a relaxed afternoon by the pool before heading to the stables to meet your horses and join your guide for a gentle evening ride across the conservancy. Return to the lodge around 6pm, just in time for sundowners and dinner. Riding time: approx. 2 hours

Each day at Sosian is shaped around your interests, but a sunrise ride ending with a bush brunch is a guest favourite - and well worth the early start. While the horses rest in the shade of an acacia tree, you’ll enjoy a generous, home-cooked spread in the heart of the wilderness. After a siesta back at the lodge, head out by vehicle in the late afternoon for a game drive, offering a new perspective on the landscape and its wildlife. Sosian is home to a remarkable diversity of species, including elephant, buffalo, hippo, giraffe, zebra, and a wide variety of antelope. Big cat sightings—particularly lion and leopard—are frequent, and the conservancy is one of the best places in Kenya to encounter endangered wild dogs. Riding alongside these elusive predators is a rare and unforgettable experience for those lucky enough to catch them. Overnight at Sosian Lodge. Riding time: approx. 4.5 hours

After a morning of lodge-based activities of your choice, set off on horseback - now well bonded with your mount - heading north across Sosian’s diverse landscapes towards your fly camp for the night. You’ll ride through varied terrain, finishing on the wide open plains typical of East Africa. Camp will be waiting with cold drinks, hot bush showers, and a three-course dinner under the stars. Horses are settled nearby on the picket line, and you’ll spend the night in simple but charming canvas tents - a wonderfully authentic experience. Overnight at Sosian Fly Camp. Riding time: approx. 4 hours

Wake with the sunrise and enjoy a hot cup of tea or coffee before saddling up for a ride east, stopping for a scenic breakfast under the shade of a tree. As you ride down into the valley, you’ll follow the winding path of the Ewaso Narok River, immersing yourself in the stunning landscape until you arrive at Suyian Soul - Laikipia’s premier eco-camp. After a delicious lunch, venture out on foot with an expert guide to discover the medicinal properties of local plants and how they are used by the indigenous tribes of the area. This is a rare opportunity to learn from the local community and deepen your connection with the land. Riding time: approx. 6 hours

After breakfast, head out for a full morning of horseback riding across the stunning plains of Suyian. With plenty of opportunities for long, exhilarating canters and jumping obstacles, this is a highlight of the ride. As we return toward the Ewaso Nyiro River, we cross onto the scenic Ol Donyo Lemboro Ranch. Arrive at Laikipia Wilderness Camp in time for lunch, then enjoy an afternoon game drive or a guided walk through the bush. This area is prime for tracking wild dogs, and encountering them on foot is an unforgettable thrill. The region is also renowned for sightings of the elusive melanistic (black) leopard - another rare and exciting experience. Riding time: approx. 3 hours

This morning, you will set off early into the stunning and untouched Mutara Valley, winding through this ‘Garden of Eden’ along a seasonal riverbed. As you ride, you are likely to encounter giraffes, elephants, eland, and buffalo, among other wildlife. We’ll pause for a bush breakfast under the shade of a large acacia tree, with plenty of fresh water for the horses. After breakfast, complete the final leg of our journey, passing seasonal marshlands as we head back to Sosian, arriving in time for a refreshing lunch by the pool. In the afternoon, unwind and relax, then enjoy an evening game drive or camel ride to sundowners, followed by a bush dinner around the campfire. If you're lucky, you might even spot a leopard on the way back to the lodge. Riding time: approx. 4 hours

Today is yours to enjoy at your own pace. For those eager to ride, a morning on the cross-country course offers plenty of fun, or if the dams are full, swimming with the horses is a unique experience. You can also explore the area by jumping off waterfalls, kayaking, mountain biking, or even experiencing cattle ranching. If you prefer to take it easy, simply relax by the pool and soak in the surroundings. Riding time: approx. 4 hours
Time to say Kwaheri (goodbye)! After a final breakfast at the lodge, you'll head back to Nairobi, arriving in time for your international flight home.
